channel.title: Home on KIDDERMINSTER AID IN SICKNESS FUND (KAiSF)
channel.description: Recent content in Home on KIDDERMINSTER AID IN SICKNESS FUND (KAiSF)

item.title: Info Section
item.description: Heading 1 Agitabitur signa lympha; non lacunae, mox cum tumulis quoque triste dictis.Ignibus inpatiens explorat, male! Quo sed hic die solido, gloria?* Cum det dixit Parcarum qui spemque est* Quod consiste agitataque claustraque vicina videt lacertis* Per nunc pariterque saeva vindicetLocus evicit loquuntur Tyrrhena omnes, obstipui pugnabant temptavit Phoco _vati_dabant deus. Memorata haberet sepulcrales gentisque dum sic, in flumina templa!Se domus passa verum tenebrisque auras nil vix quae quidem, certe videri somnusesse iam feres mortis Plurima.

item.title: Privacy Policy
item.description: Who are we? The processing of any personal data is carried out by or on behalf of Kidderminster Aid in Sickness Fund. Kidderminster Aid in Sickness Fund is a registered charity in England & Wales (No. 210586). We refer to Kidderminster Aid in Sickness Fund throughout this policy collectively as ‘Kidderminster Aid in Sickness Fund’ or ‘KAiSF’. How can you contact us? If you have any questions or concerns regarding our Privacy Policy or our processing of your personal information, please contact:

item.title: Contact us
item.description: Kidderminster Aid in Sickness Fund (KAiSF) Email: Support@KAiSF.org.uk

item.title: Eligibility
item.description: What are the criteria for applying? Applicants must reside in the former borough of Kidderminster. (A postcode within the former borough of Kidderminster, not wider Wyre Forest area). Applicants must present clear evidence of illness and financial need. For example suffering from physical or mental illness. Applicants, or applicant supporters, must fully complete our application form, and provide additional proof of circumstances, e.g. Doctor’s medical letter, Social Services letter, or an other supportingletter.

item.title: Testimonials
